stream_context.summary: Kaze spends the entire session building and debugging the Wild-West ‘Saloon’ section of Course 12. Main tasks: importing Zeina’s piano-playing Shy Guy, fixing crashes caused by RAM overflow, adding crowd reactions, directional audio panning and a cinematic “high-noon” camera for a future card-gun duel.

development_findings.summary: Zeina’s piano-playing Shy Guy model and animation were successfully imported; Kaze adjusted vertex colours and lighting to match the scene.
development_findings.quote: The lighting on this looks pretty good actually. I kind of like it. I think she did a good job vertex coloring this.

development_findings.summary: Directional audio was implemented so the piano music pans from the Shy Guy’s position.
development_findings.quote: We have one more thing to add here and that is directional audio… I’m going to pan the music so that it sounds like the guy is playing it.

development_findings.summary: NPC crowd logic added: all saloon patrons turn to stare at Mario when he interrupts the pianist.
development_findings.quote: When the piano guy stops the music, the entire bar should look at you.

development_findings.summary: Discovered a crash caused by RAM overflow; merging large collision meshes reduced ~800 triangles and fixed it temporarily.
development_findings.quote: It’s a RAM overflow… If I just make a mesh out of it that just removed 800 triangles so it should be fine now.

development_findings.summary: Refined use of object lists (e.g., ‘spawner list’ vs. ‘surface list’) to skip unnecessary interaction checks and save performance.
development_findings.quote: You can skip a whole interaction check for every object, which is huge.

development_findings.summary: Micro-optimisations: inlined a sound-thread function and reclaimed ~0.2 µs per frame; also described using cache-invalidate instructions to halve memory bandwidth in the renderer.
development_findings.quote: He just live watched me gain 0.2 microseconds of performance.

development_findings.summary: Set up a locked, letter-boxed ‘high-noon’ camera shot; bars flicker but basic framing complete.
development_findings.quote: This is the vision we were looking for… It’s high noon.

development_findings.summary: Planned next steps: model a 3-2-1 countdown prop, import the Mario Party 2 card-gun, script duel logic, further optimise memory, migrate to Fast3DX3.

context_findings.summary: Kaze learned the importance of ‘soft skills’ and joked about previously dismissing them.
context_findings.quote: Someone explained to me what soft skills are… I thought that didn’t matter.

context_findings.summary: He holds a full-time Unreal Engine 5 programming job (under NDA); ROM hacking is technically a hobby he still works on full-time.
context_findings.quote: Yes I am a programmer… that is my actual full-time job. Romhacks are technically just a hobby but I do work on them full-time.

context_findings.summary: Frustration with VS Code auto-formatting breaking mid-stream; affects productivity and mood.
context_findings.quote: Dude, the fucking not having the auto-indenting work is so annoying.

context_findings.summary: Cautious about sharing builds; worries about leaks; jokes about holding $100k as collateral.
context_findings.quote: Anyone can say ‘I won’t leak it, trust me bro’… You have to send me $100,000 and then I’ll send you the ROM.

zeina.summary: Created and rigged the piano-playing Shy Guy including dialog animations.
zeina.quote: Which Zeina has animated and modeled and he’s given him a piano too.

zeina.summary: Joined chat post-hike; Kaze showcased her work and sought her feedback.
zeina.quote: Look what I made out of your Shy Guy. You’re gonna love this.

key_stories.title: The Saloon Pianist Crash
key_stories.summary: Importing Zeina’s Shy Guy initially looked perfect until the level began crashing on load. Investigation revealed RAM overflow from excessive collision triangles. Kaze merged meshes to cut 800 triangles and restored stability.
key_stories.challenge: Level crashed immediately after adding the new enemy.
key_stories.process: Used debugger, isolated memory overflow, optimised collision geometry.
key_stories.outcome: Level runs again on real hardware; reminder that Course 12 is near memory limits.
key_stories.key_quote: Didn’t think it would happen so soon… we have to optimise the level.

key_stories.title: Making the Music Feel Local
key_stories.summary: Kaze wanted the saloon’s piano to feel diegetic. He added stereo panning tied to the Shy Guy’s position and scripted NPCs to glare at Mario if he interrupts.
key_stories.challenge: Standard background music felt disconnected from on-screen action.
key_stories.process: Implemented per-channel panning & crowd AI triggers.
key_stories.outcome: Immersive audio cue and comedic payoff; sets tone for Wild West atmosphere.
key_stories.key_quote: When the piano guy stops the music, the entire bar should look at you.

key_stories.title: High-Noon Duel Setup
key_stories.summary: Plans for a cinematic showdown: Mario and Boshi face off with a card-gun, framed by a static, letter-boxed camera and 3-2-1 countdown.
key_stories.challenge: Need Wild-West climax using N64 hardware limits.
key_stories.process: Prototyped camera lock, discussed importing Mario Party 2 gun, will model numeric countdown.
key_stories.outcome: Camera prototype done; assets & logic scheduled for next stream.
key_stories.key_quote: We’re going to have a countdown here… Whoever shoots first wins.
